heading: passage: clyde sukeforth, 98
subheading: although he was a major league catcher, sukeforth will forever be remembered as the scout who advised branch rickey to sign jackie robinson to a contract, paving the way for baseball to break the color barrier. sukeforth, whose own career was cut short after he damaged an eye in a hunting accident, was a brooklyn dodgers scout from 1936 to 1951. sukeforth later scouted for the pittsburgh pirates, where he signed roberto clemente.
